name: Grok (xAI)
description: xAI's Grok models (Grok 4, Grok 3) - frontier reasoning with live web search integration and large context windows

bestPractices.tip: Grok supports massive context (up to 2M tokens with Grok 4.1) - include full documents or codebases when relevant

examples.good: Here is the complete project codebase. Identify all security vulnerabilities, rank by severity, and provide fix recommendations.

bestPractices.tip: Grok has built-in live web search capability - you can ask about current events and real-time information

examples.good: Search for the latest best practices for React Server Components as of 2026 and summarize the key patterns with code examples.

bestPractices.tip: Use structured output format - Grok supports JSON schema output similar to OpenAI's format

examples.good: Analyze this text and return JSON with: sentiment (positive/negative/neutral), confidence (0-1), key_phrases (array of strings).

bestPractices.tip: For complex reasoning, Grok 4.1 Fast has dedicated reasoning and non-reasoning modes. Frame your request to match the depth needed.

examples.good: I need you to reason through this step by step: Given these database schema constraints, design an optimal indexing strategy that minimizes query latency while controlling storage overhead.
